verses.roman:
eka tulī-bālisa govindera hāte dilā
'prabhure śoyāiha ihāya'--tāhāre kahilā

synonyms: eka—one; tulī-bālisa—quilt and pillow; govindera—of Govinda; hāte—in the hand; dilā—delivered; prabhure—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; śoyāiha—ask to lie down; ihāya—on this; tāhāre—to him; kahilā—said.
translation: In this way he made a quilt and a pillow, which he then gave to Govinda, saying, "Ask the Lord to lie on this."
